question: Freud argued that the parts of a dream that the sleeper remembers when waking up
a: strongly influence how the sleeper will think and act the following day.
b: are symbolic of repressed desires or feelings that the sleeper cannot express directly.
c: represent deep fears and insecurities that often stem from childhood trauma.
d: are less important than the parts that are quickly forgotten when waking.
e: cannot truly be understood by anyone except the dreamer themselves.
